appendix.title: Scheduling
appendix.para: OpenIDM provides the scheduling for operations such as synchronization and reconciliation. You configure the scheduler with syntax similar to that of the cron command. The scheduler relies on the Quartz library.

You can configure the feature using the org.forgerock.openidm.scheduler service. In other words, you configure the schedule by creating a JSON file named conf/[org.forgerock.openidm.]scheduler-schedule-name.json, where [org.forgerock.openidm.] is optional and added automatically when OpenIDM reads the configuration, and schedule-name is the logical name for the scheduled operation, such as reconcile_systemXmlAccounts_managedUser.
Alternatively, modules can request scheduling themselves based on the configuration in their format and location.

section.title: Configuration File
section.para: The scheduler configuration in the file conf/[org.forgerock.openidm.]scheduler-schedule-name.json has the following format.
section.programlisting: { "enabled" : true, "type" : "cron", "startTime" : "optional time", "endTime" : "optional time", "schedule" : "cron expression", "timeZone" : "optional time zone", "invokeService" : "service identifier", "invokeContext" : "service specific context info" }

listitem.para: Specify the time and date in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.
The optional properties startTime, endTime, and timeZone can be absent, or empty.
The cron expression is described in http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/docs/tutorials/crontrigger.html and http://www.quartz-scheduler.org/docs/tutorial/TutorialLesson06.html.
The "invokeService" service identifier and "invokeContext" information can be take the following values: TODO.

A service identifier can be specified without the org.forgerock.openidm. prefix. In other words, "invokeService" : "active-sync" is equivalent to "invokeService" : "org.forgerock.openidm.active-sync".

section.title: Service Implementer Notes
section.para: Services that can be scheduled implement ScheduledService. The service PID is used as a basis for the service identifier in schedule definitions.
